activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#9709
activity.text: Sidebar Navigation Highlighting Issue

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#9660
ohcnetwork/care_fe#9660
activity.text:
> > For each route explain why we need debouncing
> 
> No need to add denouncing for all new APIs, I want to add denouncing for the two Organization searchfield and facility search field , because On every key stroke network call is made, that's not expected so Network calls should be debounced so that they are made only after the user has stopped typing for a short period, reducing unnecessary calls and improving performance.I mentioned above ,for 6 and 10 denouncing will be added

@bodhish ,can I start now

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#9660
activity.text:
> For each route explain why we need debouncing

No need to add denouncing for all new APIs, I want to add denouncing for the two 
Organization searchfield and facility search field , because On every key stroke network call is made, that's not expected so Network calls should be debounced so that they are made only after the user has stopped typing for a short period, reducing unnecessary calls and improving performance.I mentioned above ,for 6 and 11 denouncing will be added

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#9660
activity.text:
> Create a list of all API's before working on it.

- https://care-api.do.ohc.network/api/v1/auth/login/
- https://care-api.do.ohc.network/api/v1/role/
-  https://care-api.do.ohc.network/api/v1/auth/token/refresh/
-  https://care-api.do.ohc.network/api/v1/users/getcurrentuser/
- https://care-api.do.ohc.network/api/v1/users/devdistrictadmin/
-  https://care-api.do.ohc.network/api/v1/organization/?parent= &offset= &limit=              ( debouncing needed)
-  https://care-api.do.ohc.network/api/v1/organization/b04b9efa-5972-419a-892d-26169c1eac8a/users/
-  https://care-api.do.ohc.network/api/v1/patient/?geo_organization= &page= &limit= &offset= &name= 
-  https://care-api.do.ohc.network/api/v1/patient/?geo_organization= &page= &limit= &offset= &phone_number=
- https://care-api.do.ohc.network/api/v1/facility/?page= &limit= &offset= &geo_organization=    (debouncing needed)
-  https://care-api.do.ohc.network/api/v1/facility/0762ce9c-4726-4b57-ad69-aacfcf100a61/

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#9604
activity.text:
> **Describe the bug** A clear and concise description of what the bug is.
> 
> **To Reproduce** Steps to reproduce the behavior:
> 
> 1. Go to profile
> 2. Click on delete or upload button in change avatar
> 3. See , the profile avatar is not updated and I have to reload to get the result
> 
> **Expected behavior** If no one is currently working on the issue of updating the state after uploading or removing the profile avatar, it would be a good idea to create a GitHub issue for it.
> 
> Here's a short name for the issue and the expected behavior descriptio n:
> 
> ### Issue Title
> "Profile Avatar State Update"
> 
> ### Expected Behavior
> After uploading or removing the profile avatar, the state should be updated automatically without needing to reload the page.
> 
> **Screenshots** ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e30b71d9-6015-42e9-93d4-f8e1b781f470)
> 
> **Desktop (please complete the following information):**
> 
> * OS: [e.g. iOS]
> * Browser [e.g. chrome, safari]
> * Version [latest]

activity.title: ohcnetwork/leaderboard#573
activity.text:
> like already said: [#573 (comment)](https://github.com/ohcnetwork/leaderboard/issues/573#issuecomment-2559886933)

Finally, I understand this: we are performing client-side filtering during the search, but still fetching all the content from the server. What if I remove the logic that fetches data from the server during the search?

activity.title: ohcnetwork/leaderboard#573
activity.text:
> We don't even need to fetch on keystroke / filter change in the first place, since the static site generated already ships all the data for the specified date range, and it's client side filtered.

one thing I could not understand 
As per your statement, there is no need to fetch data from the server every time a user types or changes a filter. Since the static site is pre-generated and includes all the necessary data for a specified date range, filtering can be done directly on the client side without making additional server requests. Why are these network requests being made during each keystroke? Are they unnecessary, and should I remove them?
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a5076afa-5849-4771-9734-cb96acac0683)

activity.title: ohcnetwork/leaderboard#573
activity.text: > are you sure? > > Now I understand the issue. In each search, the same size of data is being fetched, but I only need the data based on the search input, so that unnecessary data is not retrieved each time. I failed to understand it because in the UI it was showing different data.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/leaderboard#573
activity.text: > are you sure? > > I think I had some misunderstanding regarding the word 'fetching.' Do you mean fetching from already available static content?

activity.title: ohcnetwork/leaderboard#573
activity.text:
> so you are saying, right now different keystrokes are yielding different contents in each of the responses?

content are same but on each key stroke we are getting different number of contents

activity.title: ohcnetwork/leaderboard#573
activity.text: > I menioned that every keystroke triggers a network request, but it is a static site and for serch operation no network calls are fired ,I understand this part .But your suggestion to prevent fetching the same static content during every keystroke for every key valueâ€”I cannot understand how different keystrokes would fetch the same content.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/leaderboard#573
activity.text:
> leaderboard is fully static site, it can't serve contents based on query params

You mentioned that static content is being served repeatedly, but the content is only loaded once when I first reload the page. I don't understand how it is being served again and again.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/leaderboard#573
activity.text:
> you could prevent fetching the same static content somehow

 Could you please help me understand when the same static content is being fetched? Fetching is performed during date changes, and at that time we are not receiving the same content, right?
